item.title: TriFlow: A Progressive Multi-Agent Framework for Intelligent Trip Planning
item.description: arXiv:2512.11271v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Real-world trip planning requires transforming open-ended user requests into executable itineraries under strict spatial, temporal, and budgetary constraints while aligning with user preferences. Existing LLM-based agents struggle with constraint sati...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> retrieval, LLM, framework, arxiv, reasoning | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: AgentBalance: Backbone-then-Topology Design for Cost-Effective Multi-Agent Systems under Budget Constraints
item.description: arXiv:2512.11426v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Model (LLM)-based multi-agent systems (MAS) are becoming indispensable building blocks for web-scale applications such as web search, social network analytics, and online customer support, where cost-effectiveness is increasingly the pr...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> model, experiment, API, LLM, large language model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: SciLaD: A Large-Scale, Transparent, Reproducible Dataset for Natural Scientific Language Processing
item.description: arXiv:2512.11192v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: SciLaD is a novel, large-scale dataset of scientific language constructed entirely using open-source frameworks and publicly available data sources.
